title: Waukegan Schools Launch Real-Time Bus Tracking App for Parents
summary: Waukegan Community Unit School District 60 (Illinois) has implemented Stopfinder, a real-time school bus tracking app that allows parents to monitor their children's bus location and estimated arrival times. The app, launched on September 22, 2025, replaces a previous non-real-time system and serves 450 bus routes across 23 schools, with over 745 families already using it.

detailed_content: Waukegan Community Unit School District 60 (IL) has introduced Stopfinder, a real-time school bus tracking application for parents. Launched on September 22, 2025, the app replaces a previous system that did not offer live tracking. Through Stopfinder, parents can monitor their child’s bus in real time—viewing its movement on a map, receiving precise arrival estimates at designated stops or schools, and setting notifications for when the bus is 5 or 10 minutes away. The system covers all 450 of the district’s bus routes, which serve 15 elementary schools, five middle schools, and three high school campuses. As of early October 2025, 745 families had enrolled in the service. District leaders, including Transportation Manager Alicia Williams and Superintendent Theresa Plascencia, highlight the app’s benefits: reducing unnecessary waiting at bus stops, enhancing awareness of student whereabouts, and offering greater peace of mind—especially in light of community safety concerns. Although implementation was planned before U.S. Department of Homeland Security’s Operation Midway Blitz (launched September 5, 2025), officials note the app may provide added reassurance to vulnerable families. To access Stopfinder, parents must follow instructions on the district’s website and submit an email request to receive a personalized registration link.
